title: 2016 Scion iM exudes funky practicality (pictures)
text:
The iM's hood hides a decidedly ordinary 1.8-liter four-cylinder engine. Published: September 27, 2015 2:30 PM PDT Photo by: Chris Paukert/CNET / Caption by: Chris Paukert 
The iM's large hatch opening and low liftover height make for easy loading and unloading. Published: September 27, 2015 2:30 PM PDT Photo by: Chris Paukert/CNET / Caption by: Chris Paukert 
While this iM is featured in Classic Silver Metallic, a range of more daring colors is also available. Published: September 27, 2015 2:30 PM PDT Photo by: Chris Paukert/CNET / Caption by: Chris Paukert 
Note how aggressively the window line appears to slant forward from this angle. Published: September 27, 2015 2:30 PM PDT Photo by: Chris Paukert/CNET / Caption by: Chris Paukert 
Unlike its Toyota Corolla sibling, LED headlamps are not available on the iM, nor is any other type of HID illumination. Published: September 27, 2015 2:30 PM PDT Photo by: Chris Paukert/CNET / Caption by: Chris Paukert 
The wraparound tail lamps have a uniquely three-dimensional quality to them. Published: September 27, 2015 2:30 PM PDT Photo by: Chris Paukert/CNET / Caption by: Chris Paukert 
Large lower air intakes suggest bigger performance potential than the iM is capable of delivering. Published: September 27, 2015 2:30 PM PDT Photo by: Chris Paukert/CNET / Caption by: Chris Paukert 
The iM's exhaust is a single-sided, single-pipe affair that is faired in nicely by the standard ground effects package. Published: September 27, 2015 2:30 PM PDT Photo by: Chris Paukert/CNET / Caption by: Chris Paukert 
Swanky 17-inch directional alloys incorporate a mix of painted and machine-faced surfacing. Published: September 27, 2015 2:30 PM PDT Photo by: Chris Paukert/CNET / Caption by: Chris Paukert 
The iM and its iA stablemate are part of a two-pronged attack to make this badge relevant again. Published: September 27, 2015 2:30 PM PDT Photo by: Chris Paukert/CNET / Caption by: Chris Paukert 
The iM's interior feels both racier and better finished than Toyota's own Corolla. Published: September 27, 2015 2:30 PM PDT Photo by: Chris Paukert/CNET / Caption by: Chris Paukert 
Deeply hooded analog gauges help keep glare to a minimum. Published: September 27, 2015 2:30 PM PDT Photo by: Chris Paukert/CNET / Caption by: Chris Paukert 
The iM's available CVT mimics a seven-speed automatic in behavior and has a dedicated sport mode. Published: September 27, 2015 2:30 PM PDT Photo by: Chris Paukert/CNET / Caption by: Chris Paukert 
You're looking at one of the simplest, most intuitive HVAC control panels in the industry. Note the dual-zone switchgear. Published: September 27, 2015 2:30 PM PDT Photo by: Chris Paukert/CNET / Caption by: Chris Paukert 
Front seats offer good comfort and are wrapped in a hard-wearing, sporty fabric. Published: September 27, 2015 2:30 PM PDT Photo by: Chris Paukert/CNET / Caption by: Chris Paukert 
There's more room than you'd think in the second row thanks to a flat floor and formal roofline. Published: September 27, 2015 2:30 PM PDT Photo by: Chris Paukert/CNET / Caption by: Chris Paukert 
Rotary-style air vents and prominent door grab handles are simple yet effective interior fixtures. Published: September 27, 2015 2:30 PM PDT Photo by: Chris Paukert/CNET / Caption by: Chris Paukert 
There's plenty of room for storage in the iM, including this center console pocket with power outlet, USB input and mini headphone jack. Published: September 27, 2015 2:30 PM PDT Photo by: Chris Paukert/CNET / Caption by: Chris Paukert 
The Scion iM delivers 20.8 cubic feet of storage space with the rear seats in place, and more than double that with the seatbacks folded. Published: September 27, 2015 2:30 PM PDT Photo by: Chris Paukert/CNET / Caption by: Chris Paukert 
This iM test model featured optional navigation, but the head unit is the same regardless of whether GPS is optioned or not. Published: September 27, 2015 2:30 PM PDT Photo by: Chris Paukert/CNET / Caption by: Chris Paukert 
This touchscreen Pioneer head unit features Bluetooth audio integration, as well as apps for functions such as Pandora streaming audio. Published: September 27, 2015 2:30 PM PDT Photo by: Chris Paukert/CNET / Caption by: Chris Paukert Hot Galleries Smart Home Sweepstakes We're giving away smart home gadgets From a DIY security camera to an automated door lock, the latest and greatest are here and up for grabs.
